raw_transcript: Teacher: Hello Maria, how are you today? Student: I am fine thank you. Teacher: Good. Today we are going to practice present perfect and past simple. Do you know the difference? Student: I think present perfect is for experiences and past simple is for completed actions. Teacher: That's correct! Can you give me an example? Student: I have visited Paris last year. Teacher: Close! That should be 'I visited Paris last year' because you specified when. Student: Oh I see, present perfect doesn't use specific time markers. Teacher: Exactly! Now try: Have you ever eaten sushi? Student: Yes, I have eaten sushi last month.

metadata.teacher_notes: Good session, student engaged well with grammar concepts
